chapters.title: Introduction to ROS 2
chapters.summary: This chapter introduces the fundamental concepts of ROS 2, its architecture, and its role in modern robotics development.

chapters.title: ROS 2 Architecture and Core Concepts
chapters.summary: Dive deeper into ROS 2's graph-based communication, exploring nodes, topics, messages, services, and actions with practical examples.

chapters.title: Working with Nodes and Topics
chapters.summary: Learn to create, manage, and debug ROS 2 nodes, and master asynchronous communication using topics and message types.

chapters.title: Implementing Services and Actions
chapters.summary: Understand synchronous and long-running communication patterns in ROS 2 through the implementation of services and action servers/clients.

chapters.title: Basic Robot Control with ROS 2
chapters.summary: Apply ROS 2 concepts to control a simulated robot, covering basic movement commands, sensor data processing, and simple navigation.

chapters.title: Introduction to Digital Twins in Robotics
chapters.summary: Explore the concept of digital twins, their importance in robotics development, and an overview of common simulation tools.

chapters.title: Gazebo Simulation Basics
chapters.summary: Set up and interact with Gazebo, creating simple environments and launching basic robot models for simulation.

chapters.title: URDF and Robot Models
chapters.summary: Learn to define robot kinematics and appearance using URDF (Unified Robot Description Format) for use in simulation and visualization.

chapters.title: Advanced Gazebo Features and ROS 2 Integration
chapters.summary: Explore advanced Gazebo plugins, sensor simulation, and seamless integration with ROS 2 for complex robotic tasks.

chapters.title: Introduction to Unity Robotics Hub
chapters.summary: Discover how Unity can be used for high-fidelity robot visualization and simulation, leveraging its powerful rendering capabilities.

chapters.title: Introduction to NVIDIA Isaac Sim
chapters.summary: Get started with NVIDIA Isaac Sim, understanding its architecture, features, and role in AI-driven robotics development.

chapters.title: Isaac Sim Environment Setup and Basics
chapters.summary: Configure your development environment for Isaac Sim, learn scene creation, object manipulation, and basic simulation controls.

chapters.title: Robot Integration and Control in Isaac Sim
chapters.summary: Integrate robot models into Isaac Sim, control their movements, and simulate sensors for perception tasks.

chapters.title: Perception and AI with Isaac Sim
chapters.summary: Utilize Isaac Sim's advanced sensor simulation and AI capabilities for object detection, segmentation, and synthetic data generation.

chapters.title: Advanced Isaac Sim for Complex Scenarios
chapters.summary: Explore advanced features like multi-robot simulation, physics-based interactions, and integration with external AI frameworks.

chapters.title: Introduction to Vision-Language-Action (VLA)
chapters.summary: Understand the convergence of computer vision, natural language processing, and robotic control for intelligent robot behaviors.

chapters.title: Speech Recognition for Robotics (Whisper)
chapters.summary: Implement speech-to-text capabilities using models like OpenAI Whisper, enabling robots to understand verbal commands.

chapters.title: Natural Language Understanding for Robot Commands
chapters.summary: Leverage Large Language Models (LLMs) to interpret complex natural language instructions and extract actionable commands for robots.

chapters.title: Robot Action and Task Planning
chapters.summary: Translate high-level natural language commands into a sequence of executable robot actions, incorporating planning and execution feedback.

chapters.title: VLA Capstone Project: Bringing It All Together
chapters.summary: Integrate Vision, Language, and Action components into a comprehensive capstone project, demonstrating intelligent human-robot interaction.
